alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 29 at 9:09PM PST until January 30 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures of 32 or colder expected. For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures of 32 or colder possible. * WHERE...North Bay Interior Mountains and North Bay Interior Valleys. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 9 AM PST Monday. For the Wind Advisory, until 1 PM PST Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions will impact unsheltered and marginally sheltered populations, kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys
